document_title: Flat warts: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_content:
Have! The HPV virus that causes flat warts is very contagious. When a normal person touches a wart on another person, the virus begins to penetrate. The disease is also transmitted through sharing personal items such as clothes, towels, etc.
In addition, the HPV virus can enter the body through wounds and small scratches on the skin. And when you touch warts on your body with your hands, then accidentally move your hands to other parts of your body, it can also spread flat warts.
Flat warts are caused by certain strains of HPV
